caption: Wall Street posts blockbuster year: Annual profits ($bn)
trend_summary: The chart shows the combined annual profits for JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, and Morgan Stanley from 2007 to 2024. Profits saw a significant dip around the 2008 financial crisis, followed by a general upward trend. A peak was reached in 2021, followed by a decline in 2022 and 2023, and a strong recovery in 2024 to approximately $142bn, the second-highest level in the period shown.
article_title: Biggest US banks notch up $142bn in profits in blockbuster 2024
reference:
News article by Stephen Gandel
Title: Biggest US banks notch up $142bn in profits in blockbuster 2024, published 2025-01-17

caption: G-SIBs as of November 2024 allocated to buckets corresponding to required levels of additional capital buffers
trend_summary: The chart displays the November 2024 list of Global Systemically Important Banks (G-SIBs), categorizing them into buckets that determine their required additional capital buffers. JPMorgan Chase is the sole bank in the highest occupied bucket (Bucket 4, 2.5%), indicating it has the highest systemic importance. Citigroup is in the next tier (Bucket 3, 2.0%), followed by Bank of America in Bucket 2 (1.5%). The highest bucket (Bucket 5, 3.5%) is empty.
article_title: JPMorgan and bank capital requirements: the long-short story
reference:
News article by Daniel Davies
Title: JPMorgan and bank capital requirements: the long-short story, published 2025-02-11

caption: Profits at large US banks set to rise year on year in first quarter
trend_summary: The stacked bar chart shows quarterly net income for six large US banks from Q2 2022 to Q1 2025 (forecast). Total profits show a cyclical pattern with a notable increase forecasted for Q1 2025. JPMorgan consistently contributes the largest portion of profits. Bank of America is the second-largest contributor, while Citigroup's profits are smaller and more variable in comparison.
article_title: Wall Street traders poised to bail out bankers in first-quarter results
reference:
News article by Joshua Franklin
Title: Wall Street traders poised to bail out bankers in first-quarter results, published 2025-04-08

caption: JPMorgan's equities trading business has a standout Q1 in 2025
trend_summary: The line graph shows JPMorgan's equities trading revenues in billions of dollars from 2014 to Q1 2025. Revenues show cyclical behavior, fluctuating between approximately $1.5bn and $2.5bn from 2014-2019 before spiking in 2020. After a subsequent dip, revenues climbed to a record high of approximately $3.8bn in the first quarter of 2025.
article_title: JPMorgan chief Jamie Dimon warns of 'considerable turbulence' in US economy
reference:
